page.title: 03Local History TWO
page.content: The parish church of St Mary Magdelene is the only church in our D block.It serves those who profess the Church of England religion and other denomination must travel at least 3 miles to worship.Alot of the carving in the church was done by a Miss Mills.When she got angry she would come to the church and carve.She carved, the alter in the lady chapel and the vicors chair.The chancel arch is distorted through settlement and leans leftwards.There are marks on the pillars from the old wood screen. In the church yard are three trees planted by fiends of St Marys to commemorate royal events.The first commemorates the marriage of Prince Charles, 1981.The other were planted in 1977 to commemorate the Silver Jubilee.
